str2: On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Or neuter pleion, or pleon comparative of polus; more in quantity, number, or quality; also the major portion.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: To go up with. From sun and anabaino; to ascend in company with.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Of Hebrew origin; Galiloea, a region of Palestine.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Of Hebrew origin; Hierusalem, the capitol of Palestine.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Whosoever, whichsoever, whatsoever.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A witness (judicially) or figuratively (genitive case); by analogy, a 'martyr'.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; a people.
